Package jetbrains.exodus.entitystore

Class PersistentEntityStoreConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • jetbrains.exodus.AbstractConfig
      • jetbrains.exodus.entitystore.PersistentEntityStoreConfig
  • public class PersistentEntityStoreConfig
extends AbstractConfig
    Specifies settings of PersistentEntityStore. Default settings are specified by DEFAULT which is immutable. Any newly created PersistentEntityStoreConfig has the same settings as DEFAULT.

    As a rule, the PersistentEntityStoreConfig instance is created along with the PersistentEntityStore one. E.g., for given environment creation of PersistentEntityStore with some tuned caching settings can look as follows: 

         final PersistentEntityStoreConfig config = new PersistentEntityStoreConfig().setBlobStringsCacheSize(4000).setCachingDisabled(true);
     final PersistentEntityStore store = PersistentEntityStores.newInstance(config, environment, "storeName");

    Some setting are mutable at runtime and some are immutable. Immutable at runtime settings can be changed, but they won't take effect on the PersistentEntityStore instance. Those settings are applicable only during PersistentEntityStore instance creation.

    Most of the PersistentEntityStoreConfig settings allow to change behaviour of different caching processes. The rest of the settings are mostly not intended for public use, but for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

    You can define custom processing of changed settings values by AbstractConfig.addChangedSettingsListener(ConfigSettingChangeListener). Override ConfigSettingChangeListener.beforeSettingChanged(String, Object, Map) to pre-process mutations of settings and ConfigSettingChangeListener.afterSettingChanged(String, Object, Map) to post-process them.

    See Also:
    PersistentEntityStore, PersistentEntityStore.getConfig()

      • REFACTORING_SKIP_ALL

        public static final java.lang.String REFACTORING_SKIP_ALL
        If is set to true then new PersistentEntityStore will skip all refactorings on its creation. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

      • MAX_IN_PLACE_BLOB_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String MAX_IN_PLACE_BLOB_SIZE
        Defines the maximum size in bytes of an "in-place" blob. In-place blob saves its content in Environment (in .xd files), not in BlobVault. "In-place" blobs are normally small blobs, saving them in Environment allows to reduce the nu,ber of files in BlobVault. Default value is 10000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_SHARED

        public static final java.lang.String BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_SHARED
        If is set to true then BlobVault uses shared (static) blob strings cache. Otherwise, BlobVault creates its own cache. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Since:
        1.0.5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_MAX_VALUE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_MAX_VALUE_SIZE
        Defines the maximum size in bytes of a blob string that can be cached in blob strings cache. Default value is 100000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Since:
        1.0.5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_SIZE

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_SIZE
        Deprecated.
        As of 1.0.5, is deprecated and has no effect. Though system property with the name "exodus.entityStore.blobStringsCacheSize" is used to configure size of blob strings cache.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOB_MAX_READ_WAITING_INTERVAL

        public static final java.lang.String BLOB_MAX_READ_WAITING_INTERVAL
        In case of usage of file system for storing of blobs writing of blob's content is performed after the commit of metadata in Xodus environment. That implies delay between transaction acknowledge and real write of data which can cause situation when blob content can be incorrectly read in another thread. To avoid such situation blob content is checked before returning to the user. If content is incomplete thread will wait specified amount of time in seconds till blob content will be completely written by the transaction, otherwise exception will be thrown.

        Default value: 300

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CACHING_DISABLED

        public static final java.lang.String CACHING_DISABLED
        If is set to true then EntityIterableCache is not operable. Not for public use, for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_SIZE
        Defines the size of EntityIterableCache. EntityIterableCache is operable only if CACHING_DISABLED is false. Default value depends on the JVM memory settings.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CACHING_DISABLED, Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_COUNTS_CACHE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_COUNTS_CACHE_SIZE
        Defines the size of the counts cache of EntityIterableCache. EntityIterableCache is operable only if CACHING_DISABLED is false. Default value is 65536.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CACHING_DISABLED, EntityIterable.getRoughCount(), EntityIterable.getRoughSize(), Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_COUNTS_LIFETIME

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_COUNTS_LIFETIME
        Defines minimum lifetime in milliseconds of a single cache count. Is applicable only if CACHING_DISABLED is false. Default value is 30000L.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CACHING_DISABLED, Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_THREAD_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_THREAD_COUNT
        Defines the number of thread which EntityIterableCache uses for its background caching activity. EntityIterableCache is operable only if CACHING_DISABLED is false. Default value is 2, if CPU count is greater than 3, otherwise it is 1.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CACHING_DISABLED, PersistentEntityStore.getAsyncProcessor(), Constant Field Values

        Mutable at runtime: yes

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_DEFERRED_DELAY

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_DEFERRED_DELAY
        Not for public use, for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. Default value is 2000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_MAX_SIZE_OF_DIRECT_VALUE

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_MAX_SIZE_OF_DIRECT_VALUE
        Defines the maximum size of "direct" value in EntityIterableCache. EntityIterableCache caches results of different queries. Direct query results are strongly referenced, otherwise they are references through SoftReference. Basically, the more direct values are the better caching performance is. Default value is 512.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_USE_HUMAN_READABLE

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_USE_HUMAN_READABLE
        Not for public use, for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_HEAVY_QUERIES_CACHE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_HEAVY_QUERIES_CACHE_SIZE
        Not for public use, for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. Default value is 2048.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_HEAVY_ITERABLES_LIFE_SPAN

        public static final java.lang.String ENTITY_ITERABLE_CACHE_HEAVY_ITERABLES_LIFE_SPAN
        Not for public use, for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. Default value is 60000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSACTION_PROPS_CACHE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String TRANSACTION_PROPS_CACHE_SIZE
        Defines the size of "property values" cache held by each StoreTransaction instance. This cache reduces load created by de-serialization of property values. Default value is 1024.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSACTION_LINKS_CACHE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String TRANSACTION_LINKS_CACHE_SIZE
        Defines the size of "links" cache held by each StoreTransaction instance. This cache reduces load created by de-serialization of links between entities. Default value is 1024.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSACTION_BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String TRANSACTION_BLOB_STRINGS_CACHE_SIZE
        Defines the size of "blob strings" cache held by each StoreTransaction instance. This cache reduces load created by de-serialization of blob string. This cache is different from the one held by BlobVault. Default value is 256.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GATHER_STATISTICS

        public static final java.lang.String GATHER_STATISTICS
        If is set to true then PersistentEntityStore gathers statistics and exposes it via JMX managed bean provided MANAGEMENT_ENABLED is also true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        MANAGEMENT_ENABLED, PersistentEntityStore.getStatistics(), Constant Field Values

      • MANAGEMENT_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String MANAGEMENT_ENABLED
        If is set to true then the PersistentEntityStore exposes two JMX managed beans. One for statistics and second for controlling the PersistentEntityStoreConfig settings. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        PersistentEntityStore.getStatistics(), PersistentEntityStore.getConfig(), Constant Field Values

      • REPLICATOR

        public static final java.lang.String REPLICATOR
        If set to some value different from null, delegate replication to corresponding external service of provided value.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        PersistentEntityStoreReplicator, Constant Field Values

      • BLOBS_DIRECTORY_LOCATION

        public static final java.lang.String BLOBS_DIRECTORY_LOCATION
        Location of directory on the file system where all blobs will be stored. Applicable only if disk based blob directory is used. If relative path is provided, path will be created relatively location of main database. If value is not provided then default value "blobs" is used. Default value null.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USE_INT_FOR_LOCAL_ID

        public static final java.lang.String USE_INT_FOR_LOCAL_ID
        Not for public use, for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail
